feat: Add Game Replay Feature

Implemented complete game replay system allowing players to review
completed games round-by-round with full trick history.

Backend Changes:
- Added getGameReplayData() and getAllFinishedGames() to db/index.ts
- Created socket events 'get_game_replay' and 'get_all_finished_games'
- Game history already stores full round_history JSONB with all tricks
- No database schema changes needed (data was already being saved)

Frontend Changes:
- Created GameReplay.tsx component with round navigation
- Displays game metadata, team scores, and round-by-round breakdown
- Shows detailed trick history with cards, winners, and points
- Added "View Game Replay" button to game over screen
- Modal UI with Previous/Next round navigation

Key Implementation Details:
- Uses player NAMES as identifiers (not volatile socket.ids)
- Player names are stable across reconnections
- Round history contains complete trick-by-trick data
- Reuses existing ScoringPhase.tsx display patterns
- Spectator-pattern compatible (no socket ID dependencies)

Documentation:
- Added critical principle to CLAUDE.md: ALWAYS use player names
  as identifiers, NEVER socket.ids (volatile)

Benefits:
- Learn from mistakes by reviewing losing rounds
- Study betting and card play patterns
- Share notable games with friends
- No performance impact (data already being saved)
